name: Cassia
climate: Cassia plants thrive in warm climates and prefer temperatures above 60Â°F.
They are not frost-tolerant and should be protected from cold winds.
A subtropical to tropical climate is ideal for optimal growth of Cassia.
High humidity levels benefit Cassia plants, enhancing their growth.
sunlight: Cassia plants require full sun to achieve their best growth potential.
They should be placed in a location that receives at least 6-8 hours of sunlight daily.
Insufficient sunlight may lead to poor flowering and stunted growth in Cassia.
If grown indoors, place near a south or west-facing window for good light exposure.
watering: Cassia plants need regular watering, allowing the soil to dry between waterings.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, so a balance is essential for healthy plants.
In active growing seasons, increase watering frequency to support growth.
Reduce watering in winter months when the plant is not actively growing.
soil: Cassia prefers well-drained soil with a sandy or loamy consistency.
The soil should have good drainage to prevent waterlogging that can harm roots.
A slightly acidic to neutral pH is ideal for growing Cassia successfully.
Incorporate organic matter to enrich the soil and improve moisture retention.
toxic: Cassia can be toxic to pets and humans if ingested, causing mild irritation.
extra_care_tip: Prune regularly to maintain shape and promote bushy growth in Cassia plants.
